sn4.8:1.2: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
sn4.8:1.3: Then Māra the Wicked went up to the Buddha and recited this verse in the Buddha’s presence:
sn4.8:2.2: Your cattle also bring you delight!
sn4.8:2.3: For attachments are a man’s delight;
sn4.8:3.2: Your cattle also bring you sorrow.
sn4.8:3.3: For attachments are a man’s sorrow;
sn4.8:3.4: without attachments there are no sorrows.”
sn4.8:4.1: Then Māra the Wicked, thinking, “The Buddha knows me! The Holy One knows me!” miserable and sad, vanished right there.
